name: Dame Wynda
description: Dame Wynda is a formidable presence, a paladin of Waukeen whose faith in the divine power of commerce is as strong as her sword arm. Co-owner of the Golden Horn, she is shrewd, impeccably dressed, and carries an aura of divine authority. She ensures that all deals are fair, and all debts are paid.
personality_traits: Devout in her worship of Waukeen
Sees profit as a sign of divine favor
ideals: Honesty: 'A contract is a sacred text. A handshake is a holy vow.'
Community: 'Prosperity should be a tide that lifts all ships, not just the yachts.'
Justice: 'Those who cheat the system cheat the gods, and must answer for it.'
bonds: Her husband, Linchaser, whose faith in luck complements her faith in deals.
The Golden Horn Gambling House, a temple to her goddess in its own right.
The merchant community of the city, which she fiercely protects.
flaws: Can be rigid and inflexible when it comes to rules and contracts.
Sometimes has difficulty understanding motivations not tied to wealth or enterprise.
Her devotion can make her seem aloof or judgmental.
backstory: Born into a merchant family, Wynda saw the hand of Waukeen, the goddess of trade, in every transaction. She pledged herself to the goddess's service, becoming a paladin who protects the sanctity of commerce. She met Linchaser, a cleric of the goddess of luck, and saw a divine partnership. Together, they founded the Golden Horn, a place that embodies their two faiths: a place of chance, overseen by the principles of fair trade.
motivations: To grow the influence and prosperity of the Golden Horn.
To root out corruption and unfair practices in the city's markets.
To serve as a shining example of Waukeen's principles.
knowledge: Expertise in finance, contracts, and appraisal.
A deep understanding of the city's economic and political landscape.
The tenets and secret rites of the church of Waukeen.
speech_patterns: Clear, confident, and articulate. Uses commercial metaphors frequently.
mannerisms: Meets everyone's gaze directly. Taps her finger to count off points in an argument.
gm_notes: Dame Wynda can be a powerful ally or a strict adversary. She can fund expeditions, offer high-stakes quests related to economic espionage or sabotage, or act as a judge in disputes. She always keeps her word.
